title: WeGotTickets
subtitle:
Today we launch a month long campaign to raise funds for @RefugeeAction. 

You can donate when buying tickets, and will also be able to leave a #WelcomeRefugees message, which will be seen by refugees around the UK - and we'll post some of them here, along with updates. pic.twitter.com/IuDbJcD442

title: Avril Johnstone
subtitle:
A chilly but important morning spent taking part in the St Andrew's Day Anti-racism March.

With hate crimes increasing, we must stand united against racism and other forms of discrimination. 

Refugees are welcome in Scotland. No one is illegal. #UnitedWeStand.pic.twitter.com/vNznasmBdA

title: Palest Return Centre
subtitle:
Acting Commissioner-General of the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East (UNRWA) has called on donor parties to increase funds urgently needed by the Agency in order to maintain its services for Palestine refugees.

title: Peace and Sport
subtitle:
To celebrate the 10-year anniversary of the #ChampionsforPeace club, this week we will highlight 
@TeglaLoroupe She was the first African woman to win the New York Marathon. Through her foundation @TeglaPeace, she is actively involved in the Kakuma Refugee camp. pic.twitter.com/OKLEJIkZc0

title: Charlie Yaxley
subtitle:
Smugglers and traffickers are increasingly diversifying their business models.

No longer so reliant on sea crossings. Also look to make money from refugees through extortion, forced labour, recruitment to armed groups, selling people as slaves, etc...  4/5 pic.twitter.com/GQFAZPoHXK

title: NACCOM
subtitle: On #GivingTuesday, we wanted to give a shout out to all the incredible charities in our network (over 100+) who work hard every single day to support people seeking asylum, refugees and many others out of destitution, and who fight tirelessly for a more humane asylum system. pic.twitter.com/MrGF38xkGC

title: Surrey Music
subtitle: Fantastic news! Our retiring collection on Saturday raised an amazing £708 for Elmbridge CAN. Charity Trustee, Steve, gave a very moving and inspiring talk about the work of the charity which welcomes, settles and supports refugees in the area. http://www.elmbridgecan.org.uk  #elmbridgepic.twitter.com/JJmHMX9GRt

title: People Not Borders
subtitle:
A wet and miserable day in Calais and Dunkirk, delivering PNB’s winter packs, sleeping bags, phones and tablets.  
We joined Mobile Refugee Support on their soup distribution a good opportunity to speak with both refugees and volunteers about the situation and current needs pic.twitter.com/9YDNsKRa2S

title: Laura Padoan
subtitle: At Oxford University this evening talking to the international development society about global refugee response and EU & UK asylum policy. 20 years ago I was too scared to apply to Oxford, so glad I made it here to finally make my immigrant dad proud!  pic.twitter.com/yPt9fUrecD – at Brasenose College
